title: Baking Recipes
text:
Preface
In this book I want to share some of my personal favorite baking recipes.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

title: Cream Cheese Cookies
text:
Directions

Start by browning the butter. Then let the browned butter cool down to room temperature.
In a bowl sift the flour, baking powder, and the salt. Then whisk all together.
In a separate bowl mix the browned butter and cream cheese at room temperature until well combined before adding the sugar. Mix to create batter.
Add the egg at room temperature and the vanilla to the batter and continue mixing.
Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix until just combined.
Chill for at least an hour, but preferably more or overnight.
Roll each dough ball to about 40 grams or to desired size.
Bake at \(375 ^\circ\) F for about 10 minutes or until the edges are turning golden brown.
Dust the cookies with powdered sugar, drizzle with melted white chocolate, or cream cheese frosting.

title: Pumpkin Bars
text:
Directions

In a bowl, start by sifting and combining all of the dry ingredients. Mix them well.
In a separate bowl, for the wet ingredients, whisk the eggs, white sugar, and the brown sugar. Whisk well.
Add the milk, pumpkin, vegetable oil, and the vanilla to the wet mixture. Whisk well.
Pour the dry into the wet and fold the batter. Don’t over mix the batter.
Line a 10 x 15 baking sheet with parchment paper and pour the batter into the sheet.
Bake for about 25 minutes at 350℉. The internal temperature of should be 195-200℉.
Let the cake cool for about 10-15 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
text:
Directions

Start by browning the butter. Then let the browned butter cool down to room temperature.
In a bowl sift and mix the dry ingredients together.
In a separate bowl mix the browned butter, brown sugar, and white sugar to create the batter.
Add the egg at room temperature and the vanilla to the batter and continue mixing.
Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix. Then add the chocolate chips and continue to mix until just combined. Do not overmix the batter.
Chill the dough for a couple hours.
If baking from

Fresh, 350 for about 10 minutes
Frozen 335-340 for about 17 minutes

title: Tres Leches Cake
text: Dirsction

title: Tres Leches Cake
text:
Directions

Separate the egg yolks and the egg whites. This is easiest when the eggs are cold. Then allow them to reach room temperature so that the egg whites are easier to whip to stiff peaks.
In a separate bowl sift and mix the dry ingredients together.
Once the egg whites are at room temperature add the stabilizer and whip the egg whites. Once the egg whites become foamy gradually add about a tablespoon of sugar until stiff peaks form. Add about 3-5 tablespoons of sugar in total.
Add the remaining sugar, milk, and vanilla to the egg yolks and begin mixing until thick and gooey in texture.
Add the dry ingredients to the egg yolk mixture.
Add a couple of dollops of the whipped egg whites to the egg yolk mixture and mix this well to loosen the batter.
Add the new mixture to the remaining whipped egg whites and fold the mixture carefully. Gentle mixing here is critical to keep as many pockets of air in the whipped whites.
Bake at \(325 ^\circ\) F for about 35-40 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. The cake should be golden brown, risen, and pulled away from the sides.

title: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
text:
Directions

Start by browning the butter. Then let the browned butter cool down to room temperature.
In a bowl sift and mix the dry ingredients together.
In a separate bowl mix the browned butter, brown sugar, and white sugar to create the batter.
Add the egg at room temperature and the vanilla to the batter and continue mixing.
Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix. Then add the oatmeal, raisins, and other mix-ins and continue to mix until just combined. Do not overmix the batter.
Chill the dough for a couple hours.
If baking from

Fresh, 350 for about 10 minutes
Frozen 335-340 for about 17 minutes
